a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:30): No, once you see <!doctype I mean

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:39): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46, so Opera actually parses this HTML5 crap correctly? :)

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:39): 34ffbf4f245e4bf8c1a57a43ddc7a902: it's not too late to sign up
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:41): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: omitting optional tags in combination with the new tags doesn't quite work
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:41): <datalist><option></datalist> for instance (think i've filed a bug about that one)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:42): note that the parsing algorithm doesn't define stuff like that so far...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:44): (not sure who I'm talking to here, everybody knows that :) )
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:46): i'm supposed to explain how <canvas> works. i need some help with that :)
34ffbf4f245e4bf8c1a57a43ddc7a902 (21:46): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: true, but i don't live there.. so kinda hairy to make all the arrangements :(
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:48): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46, you select the element, get the 2d context on it and draw stuff
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:50): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-archive/2007Apr/att-0036/html5.xml has a simple drawing application using <canvas>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:51): (although you can't actually see it in non-presentation mode)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:51): yup. i was thinking of showing some cool canvas demos at the presentation, though i won't embed them in the actual presentation
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:51): probably just link to them and switch between tabs
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:52): for my next presentation I'd like to show the doom game
